result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua P. Burns was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Provide DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua P. Burns

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua P. Burns in court with attorney Joseph Norby. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

3:35 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Court and counsel have received their copies of the PSI.
Court questions if any correction need to be made on the record.
State does not have any changes or corrections to the PSI.
Defense does not have any changes or corrections to the PSI.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing.
Court questions Att Norby regarding the drugs in family on the record.
Court questions Atty Norby how he can depreciate the seriousness of his crime.
Defendant makes statement on his behalf.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
180 day jail sentence to be imposed/stayed 
Probation for 2 years
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
Do not possess/consume a controlled substance without a valid prescription and take according to the prescription.
Pay fine of $250 + costs
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent and any other assessments as deemed appropriate by the agent.
Provide DNA sample 
Perform 40 hours of community service
2 days of jail credit
Sentencing hearing on October 28, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Joshua P. Burns in court with attorney Joseph Norby. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Information filed today- waived reading. 
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.   W/H Sentence: 24 mo Probation: Conditions:  120 days jail, $250 + costs = $820.25,   AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.   Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. Comply with any other treatment recommendations of the Agent.  Parties free to arugue sentencing.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: No Contest
Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

BTC:  PSI is ordered.
Bond is continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2014 at 03:30 pm.
Plea hearing on July 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on June 2, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 21, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued

Defendant Joshua P. Burns in court with attorney Joseph Norby. ADA Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Waives right time limits and waives preliminary hearing.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 10:00 am.

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Possession with intent to deliver. 
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court questions the defendant.
Defendant is employed thru the Noel Group as a Directory Assistance Operator. 
Atty Knaapen recommends a $500 cash bond with conditions as stated. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  03/31/14  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons using illegal controlled substances.
